snippet: Houston’s combined no-hitter on June 11, 2003, was the first no-hitter against the Yankees in the Bronx since 1952. They have not been no-hit since.
abstract: Houston Astros combined no-hitter on June 11, 2003, was first no-hitter against New York Yankees at Yankee Stadium since 1952, and the first no-hitter in history to feature six pitchers; team is returning to the Bronx for a three-game series, something that will become a regular occurrence now that Astros have shifted to the American League.
lead_paragraph: Houston’s combined no-hitter on June 11, 2003, was the first no-hitter against the Yankees in the Bronx since 1952. They have not been no-hit since.

headline.seo: When Astros Made History With No-Hitter Against Yankees
headline.main: A No-Hitter So Rare It Took 6 Pitchers
